bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of abdominal drum-like distension, and a feeling of heart-pressure and fullness, brought forth by qi stagnation. Pu ji fang 普濟方 168, comment added to Recipe Entry wu ji san fang 五積散方 , recipe for the powder for five types of accumulation: 五積散， 治五積六聚，並酒積蠱氣所傷…傷酒葛根湯下，傷食鹽湯下，氣蠱木香 湯下，水蠱樟柳根湯下 , “The ‘powder for the five accumulations’ cures the five accumulations [in the five depots] and six collections [in the six palaces], and also wine accumulation as well as damage caused by gu qi ... For damage caused by wine, ingest it with a decoction of ge gen ; for damage caused by food, ingest it with brine; for qi gu ingest it with a decoction of mu xiang ; for water gu ingest it with a decoction of zhang liu roots”
